Buying A $50 Mini PC that performs Just As Good As My $500 Laptop

March 2, 2025

Earileir this year I set out to buy new work computer. In my life I've owned about a hundred computers ranging from $1000 laptops to the free desktop someone gives you because they know you like computers so I've gotten really good at spotting the pros and cons on between diffrent types. I did some research for a couple of days and I ended up purchasing The Lenovo Power Station 183C. This computer has been the best computer for the cost I've ever bought.

It has a Ryzen 3 2400GE CPU and 8 Gigs of RAM and let me tell you this computer works almost as good as my $600 laptop.

Earileir this year I set out to buy new work computer. My goal was to find a cheap work horse for making websites and web design content. Nothing too crazy like video editing.

Some Of My Requiremnents For This Computer

I didn't want to spend a lot of money so a budget of $50 - $80 dollars.

A computer capable of handling multitasking without performence issues (lag, freeze, etc.).

Some of the software I use when I'm working are programs like VSCode, Inkscape, GIMP, Figma etc. basically a lot of programs for making websites and web content. These programs don't require a lot of RAM & CPU to run individually but when their used in a work envioremnet where you're constantly switcthing from window to window it can create issues especially on computers with lower end chip sets.

After googling variations of the phrase "cheapest mini pc under $100" I came to a few conclusio these ryzen chipsets where one of the few chipsets that started outperformein
